radiographic_examinations.findings: Enlarged folds extending from the stomach to the beginning of the jejunum, multiple nonbleeding erosions, evidence of chronic active gastritis.
Confirmed diverticulosis, no obvious abnormalities of the small bowel, no evidence of lymphadenopathy.
Prominent folds throughout the stomach and duodenum.
Prominent mucus-secreting polypoid folds with intermittent erosions throughout the colon and terminal ileum.
Nodular and polypoid-appearing small bowel with erythematous and edematous mucosa throughout.
